SEARCH
Package control

Class InputOutput

java.lang.Object
control.InputOutput
public class InputOutput extends Object

Input and Output Class

This class is used to handle all the inputs and outputs happen in the system.
Author:
Mohamed Essam, Maya Ayman, Rawan Younis

  • Method Details

    • takeUserInput

      public User takeUserInput() throws SQLException
      This Method takes all the user input as a template method, and check weather he is registered or not.
      the registration is confirmed with otp verification code.
      Returns:
      User that will be added to the system.
      Throws:
      SQLException - to handle database errors

    • registerForm

      public void registerForm()
      This Method is output the registration form to the user

      It takes username input from user.
      Returns:
      Username

    • takeEmailInput

      It takes email input from user.
      Returns:

    • takePasswordInput

      public String takePasswordInput()
      It takes password input from user. and then encode the password.
      Returns:
      Password

    • takePhoneNumberInput

      public String takePhoneNumberInput()
      It takes Phone Number input from user.
      Returns:
      the phone number

    • takeAddressInput

      public Address takeAddressInput()
      It takes address input from user.
      Returns:
      Address of the user

    • checkOutOptions

      public Integer checkOutOptions()
      This Method shows the checkout options menu to the user.
      1. Enter new Address.
      2. User Address on the System.
      Returns:
      Integer the user choice in checkout page.

    • orderOptions

      public Integer orderOptions()
      This Method shows the Order options menu to the user.
      1. Confirm Order.
      2. Decline Order (return to catalog page).
      Returns:
      Integer the user choice in order page

    • getInteger

      @NotNull public @NotNull Integer getInteger(String info, int optionSize)
      This Method takes integer input from the user
      and validate that user enters an integer not a string
      Parameters:
      info - the msg shown to the user
      optionSize - the size of option menu
      Returns:
      Integer the user choice from the options

    • validateIntegerInput

      public void validateIntegerInput(String option)
      Validate that the user input is an Integer.
      Parameters:
      option - the user choice

    • checkCertainNumber

      public boolean checkCertainNumber(int chosenOption, ArrayList<Integer> availableOptions)
      This Method check that user enters a valid option number.
      Parameters:
      chosenOption - the user choice number
      availableOptions - the range of all available options
      Returns:
      boolean to identify weather input is integer or not.
